page.title: 20MEDIA..LOCAL NEWS
page.content: This article is from the {Fife Herald} of June 14th 1985. It concerns brigadier David Anderson who lives in our D-Block. {MANY APPLY FOR TOP POST} More than 100 enquiries- which include a substantial number of applications- have been submitted to N.E.F.D.C in connection with the vacancy for a chief executive. This was confirmed yesterday by a senior council official, who revealed that the enquiries had come from people in commerce, industry, local goverment and the armed forces. The post, vacated last week by the brigadier, carries a salary of between Â£21762 and Â£23343. Today is the final date for submission of applications. A short leet will de drawn up at a special Council meeting a week on Tuesday.
